action.action-desc: Mr. Scott of Virginia introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend chapter 44 of title 18, United States Code, to clarify the circumstances under which the enhanced penalty provisions for subsequent convictions apply.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Recidivism Clarification Act of 2015.

subsection.text: Section 924(c) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking Except to the extent that a greater minimum sentence is otherwise provided by this subsection or by any other provision of law, any and inserting Any;
in each of subparagraphs (A) through (C), by striking less each place it appears and inserting more; and

clause.text: by striking In the case of a second or subsequent conviction under this subsection and inserting If a person is convicted under this subsection after a prior conviction under this subsection has become final; and
in clause (ii), by striking imprisonment and inserting a term of imprisonment for any term of years or;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking less and inserting more; and
in subparagraph (B)(i), by striking punished by death or; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

The provisions of section 411 of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 851), other than subsections (a)(2) and (e) of such section, as in effect on the date of the enactment of this paragraph, shall apply to sentencing for convictions under this subsection in the same manner in which such provisions apply to sentencing for offenses under part D of title II of such Act.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to conduct engaged in, and sentences imposed before, on, or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
